one_reviews_text: Great game to play local co-op. You do need to use a contoller, but other than that, I think it's a good deal for the price we paid ($10).

Back before this was on Oculus, one of the big bugs was that you couldn't snap-turn left with the oculus touch controllers.  It's now been out on Oculus for a while and snap-turning still isn't fixed.  I'm not gonna turn right three times to turn left folks.

The game itself plays well enough, but for $10 it's a waste of cash. The graphics are so minimal, and the lack of any sort of light mapping makes the game just feel stale and flat. The silly looking box enemies took me out the experience, and everything was so minimal I couldn't enjoy the experience.
It had a solid foundation, and a cool idea, but I've played games 100x better for $2.
This is a lot of fun to play with two people. I wish you could use a controller as well but still a great game.

If they had tested this game on the Oculus platform, which they clearly haven't, they would have realized that there are buttons on the Oculus touch controller that DONT WORK. I'm sick of games converting their crappy bs from the steam/vive world and spending 10 minutes on the port. The controllers are DIFFERENT. Get your thick crappy steam vive podunk skull wrapped around that and do some GD testing. You get NOTHING because I can't even play the game.
review_feedback:
Hi stealthkk,
We’re sorry for your troubles. If you’d like to tell us more
about your issue so that we can help you resolve it, please email us at blackhatoculus@gmail.com.

We’re thinking this might be a rare case. But we could be wrong! And we’d like to help if we can.

one_reviews_text: Game supports local play but never did it say that it was ONLY local play.  Friend and I bought this game thinking we could play together on two different computers.   Will change my review if game gets an update to include online multiplayer

review_title: There needs to be more games like this
one_reviews_text: I love these asynchronous games. I wish more developers would consider it. It makes having friends over and using VR a lot more fun.

I like VR games you can play with groups and everyone wins together; this one maybe 3 people max. Especially fun with young ones, but someone needs to be able to type fast; nice way to split responsibilities. Learn communication skills and cooperation is a super fun way! Warning: sensitive people can get motion-sickness.
If you are interested in a co-op game this is one of the 2 must buys on oculus (keep talking an nobody exploes also)
Perfect for playing with a friend. This is a fun game of "hacking" with one player in the headset and the other at the mouse & keyboard.

Game supports local play but never did it say that it was ONLY local play.  Friend and I bought this game thinking we could play together on two different computers.   Will change my review if game gets an update to include online multiplayer
